name: ARROW STORM ATTACK
description: Blotting out the sun with her volleys, the Exalt routs legions. Spend 1 mote on Step 5 of a Ranged Combat attack against a battle group. The Exalt increases her damage dice or the Power generated on the attack by the battle group’s Size. At Essence 3, the bonus damage becomes successes on Step 7, instead.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Cascade of Cutting Terror
modes.effect: At Essence 2, a Solar may spend 2 Anima to reduce the target battle group’s Defense to 1 on Step 4.

name: DOUBLE DISTANCE TECHNIQUE
description: The Exalt’s attacks fly far and true. The Exalt extends the reach of one of her ranged weapons by one range band. This cannot supplement attacks made with pure Essence (such as attack spells or Glorious Exalted Bolt).

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Triple Distance Technique
modes.effect: The Solar may spend 1 mote to extend the range an additional band, to a maximum of extreme range.

name: GLORIOUS EXALTED BOLT
description: The Exalt forms a blazing bolt of Essence aligned with their nature to strike their enemies. Commit 1 mote on Step 1. This does not count as the Exalt’s Charm on that Step. For the duration of the scene, make ranged Essence attacks at medium range using either Sagacity or Ranged Combat. Treat as a heavy ranged weapon with medium range, the artifact and powerful tags. Spend 1 anima to increase range to long. This may be used during a clash.

modes.name: Alchemical
modes.title: Essence Pulse Cannon
modes.effect: The Exalt’s forearm transforms into a weapon itself, storing a charge of Essence in its bore. If the Alchemical uses Glorious Exalted Bolt to enact the knockback gambit, reduce the cost by two.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Blazing Solar Bolt
modes.effect: Commit 1 additional mote to increase the attack’s damage by two.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Elemental Bolt Attack
modes.effect: Spend an additional mote on Step 7. Create an environmental hazard in the target’s range band which persists until the start of the next round. Targets hit must make a reflexive Physique roll at difficulty 3 to resist environmental damage equal to the Exalt’s Essence plus two.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Crypt Bolt Attack
modes.effect: Ignore 1 Soak, and mundane armor is destroyed as long as a decisive damage roll generates at least one success. These must be successes on the roll, not successes from the Charm or its damage rating.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Radiant Fury Revenge
modes.effect: The Infernal gains a two-dice bonus to damage if she has a negative Intimacy towards the target.

name: NO ARROW WASTED
description: The Exalt’s arrow always hits a useful target, even if it’s not their primary one. On Step 5 of a ranged combat action, if the Exalt’s original attack failed to defeat her target’s Defense, spend 1 mote and 1 anima. Declare a different target and roll a ranged attack against that target instead. The redirected attack may target objects in the environment as well as other combatants. This attack cannot be modified by Charms.

name: PHANTOM ARROW
description: The Exalt never need fear exhausting her supply of ammunition, for her Essence is a never-ending font of it. Commit 1 mote. For as long as the mote remains committed, the Exalt draws ammunition from her anima. This reduces all Ranged Combat penalties by one, including flurry penalties, to a minimum of zero. No narrative effect can force the Exalt to be out of ammunition.

modes.name: Sidereal
modes.title: Generalized Ammunition Technique
modes.effect: A Sidereal may fire literally anything she can pick up from a ranged weapon. While most improvised ammunition functions as normal shots or arrows, certain things (such as a venomous snake) may have additional effects (such as poisoning the target).

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Inexhaustible Solar Bolts
modes.effect: A Solar’s anima ammunition adds 1 Overwhelming, and will never strike an unintended target, dissolving into specks of light before contact.

name: REFLEX SHOT TECHNIQUE
description: The Exalt’s instincts align in a perfect moment, allowing her to take careful aim even when she doesn’t have the time to do so. Spend 1 mote. The Exalt uses her reflexive move action while simultaneously taking an aim action. This does not count as the Exalt’s Charm on that Step.

name: REVOLVING BOW DISCIPLINE
description: The Exalt fires shot after shot with focus and speed. Spend 2 motes on Step 1. After resolving a Ranged Combat attack, the character makes a second Ranged Combat attack against the same target or a different one. This attack is treated as though it were part of a flurry. The initial attack does not suffer the dice penalty.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Trance of Unhesitating Speed
modes.effect: The second attack is made without a dice penalty.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Trance of Unhesitating Speed
modes.effect: The second attack is made without a dice penalty.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Trance of Unhesitating Speed
modes.effect: The second attack is made without a dice penalty.

modes.name: Lunar
modes.title: Hunter’s Eye Precision
modes.effect: The second attack may be substituted for any other Finesse-based combat action, instead.

modes.name: Sidereal
modes.title: Every-Direction Arrow
modes.effect: Reduce the flurry penalty on the second attack to one die.

name: SHARPSHOOTER’S CLEVER TRICKS
description: With a flourish, the Exalt fires a shot or hurls her weapon with intent to distract. Commit 1 mote for the scene. When the Exalt purchases this Charm, choose two of its unique modes. Repurchase (Ranged Combat 4): Gain an additional mode.

modes.name: Universal
modes.title: Archer’s Keen Eye
modes.effect: Reduce all penalties from the environment, poor visibility, or other hazards on Ranged Combat attacks by the Exalt’s Essence, to a minimum of zero.

modes.name: Universal
modes.title: Clever Projectile Technique
modes.effect: Reduce the cost of gambits using Ranged Combat by one, to a minimum of one. The Exalt gains two bonus dice to using the distract gambit with Ranged Combat.

modes.name: Universal
modes.title: Sharpshooter’s Devious Ploy
modes.effect: The Exalt may use Build Power actions with Ranged Combat by making non-attack warning shots or distracting volleys. This action benefits from the weapon’s Overwhelming rating, but no other equipment bonuses.

modes.name: Universal
modes.title: Trick Arrow Shot
modes.effect: The Exalt may enact the ensnare and pull gambits without a weapon that has the corresponding weapon tags. She may spend 1 mote on Step 1 to use ensnare to entangle a battle group or character with legendary size. This does not count as her Charm for that step.

modes.name: Sidereal
modes.title: Strange Quiver Trick
modes.effect: The Sidereal transforms her ammunition midflight, granting it two of the following tags: artifact, disarming, flame, piercing, pulling, or powerful. The Sidereal may commit 1 mote to gain this effect indefinitely but chooses a tag up front.

name: STREAMING ARROW STANCE
description: One by one, her projectiles turn away attacks and her warning shots make enemies think twice about getting close. Commit 1 mote for the scene. While Streaming Arrow Stance is active, the Exalt calculates her Defense using Ranged Combat instead of Close Combat or Athletics. How the character does this is up to the player; perhaps she blocks with the bow itself, throws weapons to defer foes, or fires arrows that knock other projectiles out of the air, etc.
